list_definition.definition: a principle or emotion which makes someone act

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The spirit of kindness seems to be lacking in the world nowadays.

list_definition.definition: a person’s mind, will, personality etc thought of as distinct from the body, or as remaining alive eg as a ghost when the body dies

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Our great leader may be dead, but his spirit still lives on
Evil spirits have taken possession of him.

list_definition.mean_english: lòng can đảm, tính hăng hái

list_ex_of_english: Talent is perhaps closest in spirit to gate.
It was in that spirit that we undertook our task.
As against professionalism, then, politeness was allied with the spirit of the amateur.
The idea is thus close in spirit to the proposals described above.
But it was unscholarly, in the sense that doubtful and questionable matter was accepted in an uncritical spirit and interspersed among documents of reliable authenticity.
The first part of this study deals with identification of these spirits with their modern counterparts.
They belong instead to a spirit realm and, since they lack souls, they gain power over humans.
The spirit displayed a scroll containing a lengthy summary of his expedition.
